Topic.Title: [solved] How do I get multiple empty spaces between two text processor commands?

Posts.EditableText:
So, I have this **centered message**. ``` Please choose! {command:option1:One} {command:option2:Two} ``` But no matter how many empty spaces I put between the two commands, it keeps printing like this: >

Please choose!

>

One Two

...No empty spaces between the two commands...
Posts.HTML:
So, I have this centered message.

Please choose! 

{command:option1:One}          {command:option2:Two}

But no matter how many empty spaces I put between the two commands, it keeps printing like this:

Please choose!

One Two

...No empty spaces between the two commands...

Posts.EditableText:
There is a really hacky way to do it.  Hacky is typically the only way I know how to code.

<font color = "red">_________________</font>

<font color = "white">OMG!! It's WHITE font!</font>

Choice 1!<font color = "white">________________</font>Choice 2!

Go ahead and highlight the white space above this message.  HACKY ACHIEVED!!

```
<font color = "red">__________________</font>

<font color = "white">OMG!! It's WHITE font!</font>

<font color = "white">________________</font>
```
You can use that last line of code to create spaces.

There is a more elegant way to do it.  I think.  But I don't know the proper code to put in there!  lol
Posts.HTML:

<font color = "white">________________</font>

You can use that last line of code to create spaces.

There is a more elegant way to do it. I think. But I don't know the proper code to put in there! lol

Posts.EditableText:
Choice 1                 Choice 2
```
Choice 1                 Choice 2
```
The ` ` ... the 'm' creates roughly 4 spaces whereas the 'n' is a normal space.  Who knew?  Haha.

Now the ensp and the emsp I've never used to create spaces.  I have used the white font trick.
Good luck!
Posts.HTML:
Choice 1                 Choice 2

Choice 1                 Choice 2

The   ... the 'm' creates roughly 4 spaces whereas the 'n' is a normal space. Who knew? Haha.

Now the ensp and the emsp I've never used to create spaces. I have used the white font trick.
Good luck!

Posts.EditableText:
Nice and thanks for this useful chart. I've tested ** **, **&emsp** and **&ensp**. All three created a linebreak instead of a space. Even if I used each code just once. Then I tried to make a string attribute containing six spaces. ``` game.sixspaces = " " PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One}" + game.sixspaces + "{command:command_two:Two}< br/>
") ``` ...but it printed just a single space. Then I tried to type that value multiple times. ``` game.onespace = " " PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One} " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " {command:command_two:Two}< br/>
") ``` ...and even this printed only one empty space. -
Posts.HTML:
Nice and thanks for this useful chart.

I've tested &nbsp, &emsp and &ensp. All three created a linebreak instead of a space. Even if I used each code just once.

Then I tried to make a string attribute containing six spaces.

game.sixspaces = "      "
PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One}" + game.sixspaces + "{command:command_two:Two}< br/><br/>")

...but it printed just a single space. Then I tried to type that value multiple times.

game.onespace = "      "
PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One} " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " " + game.onespace + " {command:command_two:Two}< br/><br/>")

...and even this printed only one empty space. -

Posts.EditableText:
Sounds like Quest trims printed text...
There may be a way around this...
How about inserting a word between commands:
 {command:  option1:   One      }  or    {command:  option2:   Two      }
And, no, the extra spaces did not work

I posted here about formatting numbers, even Roman Numerals...
I think I had a way to print spaces too...
Like space(10), will print 10 blank spaces...
Posts.HTML:
Sounds like Quest trims printed text...
There may be a way around this...
How about inserting a word between commands:
{command: option1: One } or {command: option2: Two }
And, no, the extra spaces did not work

I posted here about formatting numbers, even Roman Numerals...
I think I had a way to print spaces too...
Like space(10), will print 10 blank spaces...

Posts.EditableText: How about: OneTwo (that's `` to create a 6cm space. You can specify distances in cm, in, pt (points), px (pixels), %, em (width of a letter 'm'), en (width of a 'n') or a handful of other odd units) Or: Like this, if I type more than one space, they all appear (Created using the code: `text goes here`) (This last method, "pre" means that spaces appear as spaces but long lines of text will cause a horizontal scrollbar instead of wrapping, "nowrap" means that any number of spaces gets reduced to one, and "pre-wrap" means that spaces appear as spaces, but word-wrap works as normal)
Posts.HTML:
How about:
OneTwo

(that's <img style="width:6em;"/> to create a 6cm space. You can specify distances in cm, in, pt (points), px (pixels), %, em (width of a letter 'm'), en (width of a 'n') or a handful of other odd units)

Or:
Like this, if I type more than one space, they all appear

(Created using the code: <span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">text goes here</span>)
(This last method, "pre" means that spaces appear as spaces but long lines of text will cause a horizontal scrollbar instead of wrapping, "nowrap" means that any number of spaces gets reduced to one, and "pre-wrap" means that spaces appear as spaces, but word-wrap works as normal)

") ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/37847430-d1eaf8f2-2e9e-11e8-933b-281dba6b71fd.png) --- ``` PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One} __________________ {command:command_two:Two}

") ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/37847530-1857f312-2e9f-11e8-8c1e-67dfb2fcb9f7.png) --- ``` PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One} {command:command_two:Two}

") ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/37847626-6f6f995c-2e9f-11e8-8509-cc4aebcc2ee5.png) --- ``` PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One} {command:command_two:Two}

") ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/37847759-e8a0238c-2e9f-11e8-8b3a-36fcf6240d2f.png) --- ``` game.sixspaces = "      " PrintCentered ("Please choose!
{command:command_one:One}" + game.sixspaces + "{command:command_two:Two}

") ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/37847736-d606cd48-2e9f-11e8-9121-c9dd69f1b3a9.png)
Posts.HTML:
These also work:

PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One}   {command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")


PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One}      {command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")


PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One} <font color = '"+game.defaultbackground+"'>__________________</font> {command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")


PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One} <img style='width:6em;'/> {command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")


PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One} <span style='white-space: pre-wrap;'>      </span> {command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")


game.sixspaces = "      "
PrintCentered ("Please choose!<br/>{command:command_one:One}" + game.sixspaces + "{command:command_two:Two}<br/><br/>")
